snippet: As Tom Wheeler tries to thread the needle of politics and public policy, he must face down Congress and a technology industry wary of regulations.
abstract: Challenge facing Tom Wheeler, chairman of Federal Communications Commission, to shape rules for open Internet only grew after Pres Obama spoke out on issue; people who have met with Wheeler since those comments say he has been defensive and angry that he might be seen as political pawn instead of head of an independent agency.
lead_paragraph: As Tom Wheeler tries to thread the needle of politics and public policy, he must face down Congress and a technology industry wary of regulations.

headline.main: Pressure Mounts on F.C.C. Chief Over Net Neutrality Rules
headline.print_headline: Political and Public Pressure Mounts on F.C.C. Head Over Open Internet Rules
